instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Power
threads.message: Hi. I am working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with no power. All S5 rails are present but missing S4 and below. I found that <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> is missing so I traced that back to the CPU. Found that <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> is missing. Checked for <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is missing as well. Based on schematic, this signal is generated by <CHIP>U8160</CHIP> but on the board its NC. Now I am lost. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Power
threads.message: Liquid spill? Check <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> again for pulses, any failure in the power sequence will cause the board to power cycle.
